video.title: Unreal Engine 5 - Beginner's Tutorial (with Blueprint)
video.description:
This course will teach you how to create games in Unreal Engine 5. The course covers the Blueprint Visual Scripting system which is a complete gameplay scripting system based on the concept of using a node-based interface to create gameplay elements from within Unreal Editor.

✏️ Course created by Varnos Games. Check out their channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCrqpedrZjpjmzXBqRGRP5QA
🔗 Varnos Games website: https://www.varnosgames.com/

⭐️ Course Contents ⭐️
⌨️ Blueprints in Unreal Engine
⌨️ Basics of Unreal Engine 5
⌨️ UI/UX
⌨️ Win/Loss events
⌨️ Basic Level design

🎉 Thanks to our Champion and Sponsor supporters:
👾 Raymond Odero
👾 Agustín Kussrow
👾 aldo ferretti
👾 Otis Morgan
👾 DeezMaster

--

Learn to code for free and get a developer job: https://www.freecodecamp.org

Read hundreds of articles on programming: https://freecodecamp.org/news

replies.author: pravardh cv

topLevelComment.author: Royston Shufflebotham
topLevelComment.text: Just tried to follow this with the release of UE5; so many things are completely different (screen layout, Place Actors tab, presence of character vs player start, getting hold of the landscape tooling) to what's shown here that it's very to follow. Couple that with the way the presenter is jumping around and changing his mind about what he's actually demonstrating, I've had to give up after 25 minutes I'm afraid.

replies.author: nope
replies.text: I was following a long with UE  5 then I just started watching it , I think you can still complete it, you just have to be willing to watch some sections a few times.

replies.author: pravardh cv
replies.text: That's true, I made this course when UE5 was in preview. Sorry about that. This was my first course so I was a little all over the place. I'll try to do better next time :)

topLevelComment.author: Steve Hadley
topLevelComment.text: This was an amazing tutorial.  I have now actually created my first game and it all works.  I gained an understanding of level creation and will be building upon the lessons learned here.  Thank you so much for this video, it prompted me to subscribe and I will be watching more.  If you added time stamps and chapter headings, this would be fantastic.  I suspect I m not the only one who might need to look for particular parts of the video again, to remind me of some items that did not stick completely, the first time round.

topLevelComment.author: Dimaur
topLevelComment.text: what laptop spec needed to use unreal 5,

replies.author: Varnos Games
replies.text:
Minimum:-
16 GB ram
intel i5 or AMD equivalent (at least 6 cores)
A decent graphics card with at least 2 GB VRAM
A good cooling system
